bibl.title: Jennie Miller Powers v. Mary Elizabeth Miller and R. J. Miller. Decision
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
Territory of Washington
3d Judicial District} SS
In the District Court holding terms at Seattle in King County.

In the matter of the application of Jennie Miller Powers for Writ of Habeas Corpus
vs.
Mary Elizabeth Miller and R.J. Miller her husband
} No. 5902

This matter having been adjorned from time to time, Now on now on this 12th day of May, 1888, the same comes on to be heard upon the allegations and proofs of the parties and the arguments of counsel, J.M. Hall, Eben Smith and J.T. Littell, Esquires appearing for the applicant and Jennie Miller Powers and Messrs Lewis & Gilman appearing for the respondents Mary Elizabeth Miller and R.J. Miller, her husband, and the Court being freely advised in the premises it is now by the court held considered and adjudged that the infant Mary Alice Powers be delivered into the care and custody of her mother, towit: the said Jennie Miller Powers and that said Jennie Miller Powers hereafter have the exclusive care, control and custody of the said infant the said Mary Alice Powers. And now the said
Mary Alice Powers is in open Court delievered into the custody of the said Jennie Miller Powers. And it is now further considered and adjudged by the Court now here that the applicant herein the said Jennie Miller Powers do have and recover of and from the respondents herein the said Mary Elizabeth Miller and herR.J. Miller her husband or either of them the costs and disbursements of this proceeding taxed at fifty four dollars and ten cents and that Execution issue therefor.
